Questions.Question: What is the name of the cafe where the Friends characters often hang out?
Questions.Explanation: Central Perk, located in New York City, was the central meeting place for the main characters of the iconic TV show 'Friends'.

Questions.Question: Which actor played the character Michael Scott in the US version of 'The Office'?
Questions.Explanation: Steve Carell portrayed the hilariously awkward and inappropriate boss, Michael Scott, throughout the show's seven seasons.

Questions.Question: In 'How I Met Your Mother', what is the name of Ted Mosby's future wife?
Questions.Explanation: Tracy McConnell, also known as 'The Mother', is revealed to be Ted's future wife in the final season.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the bar where the characters of 'Cheers' gather?
Questions.Explanation: The show is named after the bar where employees and regulars, including Sam Malone and Diane Chambers, share their lives.

Questions.Question: Which character from 'The Big Bang Theory' has a PhD in neuroscience?
Questions.Explanation: Amy Farrah Fowler eventually earns her Ph.D. in neurobiology and becomes a successful researcher in the series.

Questions.Question: What is the occupation of the title character in 'Mork & Mindy'?
Questions.Explanation: Mork, portrayed by Robin Williams, is an extraterrestrial who comes to Earth from the planet Ork in an egg-shaped spaceship.

Questions.Question: In 'Parks and Recreation', which character famously loves waffles?
Questions.Explanation: Leslie Knope, the optimistic and determined Parks and Recreation director, has an undying love for waffles and their pairing with whipped cream.

Questions.Question: Who lives across the hallway from Sheldon and Leonard in 'The Big Bang Theory'?
Questions.Explanation: Penny, an aspiring actress and waitress, becomes an integral part of the group's dynamic as the series progresses.

Questions.Question: On 'Seinfeld', what is Jerry's catchphrase when something doesn't add up?
FalseAnswer: Not that there's anything wrong with that
Questions.Explanation: Jerry Seinfeld's catchphrase, 'That's a shame,' is often used to express disappointment or disbelief.

Questions.Question: Which '90s sitcom featured the Winslow family and their nerdy neighbor, Steve Urkel?
Questions.Explanation: The lovable and quirky character Steve Urkel, played by Jaleel White, became a breakout star of 'Family Matters'.

Questions.Question: In 'Brooklyn Nine-Nine', what is Captain Holt's dog's name?
Questions.Explanation: Cheddar is Captain Raymond Holt's adorable corgi, who often serves as a source of comic relief in the series.

Questions.Question: Who is the landlord of the main characters in 'Three's Company'?
Questions.Explanation: Mr. Roper, along with his wife, landlord the building where Jack, Janet, and Chrissy reside, leading to comedic misunderstandings and situations.

Questions.Question: Which '90s sitcom features a group of six friends living in Chicago, dealing with everyday situations?
Questions.Explanation: 'Friends' gains its charm from the camaraderie and chemistry between the six central characters as they navigate life and relationships.

Questions.Question: In 'Scrubs', what is the name of J.D.'s best friend and fellow doctor?
Questions.Explanation: The close friendship and humorous dynamic between J.D. and Turk form a core element of the heartfelt and comedic series.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the company where the characters in 'The IT Crowd' work?
Questions.Explanation: Reynholm Industries, led by the eccentric boss Douglas Reynholm, serves as the setting for the quirky misadventures of the IT department employees.

Questions.Question: Which character in 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air' is known for his Carlton dance?
Questions.Explanation: Alfonso Ribeiro's portrayal of Carlton Banks popularized the iconic dance, often performed to Tom Jones' 'It's Not Unusual'.

Questions.Question: What is the name of Elaine's eccentric boss in 'Seinfeld'?
Questions.Explanation: Mr. Pitt, known for his odd quirks and high expectations, creates amusing workplace scenarios for the characters.

Questions.Question: In 'Arrested Development', what is the name of the Bluth family's banana stand employee?
Questions.Explanation: Gob, short for George Oscar Bluth II, is known for his ineptitude and theatrical performances as the Bluth family's magician.

Questions.Question: Which character in 'The Golden Girls' was a substitute teacher?
Questions.Explanation: Blanche Devereaux, known for her Southern charm and romantic escapades, pursued a brief career as a substitute teacher in the series.

Questions.Question: What is the name of the cafe where Jerry and his friends frequently gather in 'Seinfeld'?
Questions.Explanation: Monk's Cafe serves as the iconic setting for the characters' conversations, debates, and mishaps throughout the iconic series.
